title: Eddie is brilliant at taking the heat off players - and anyway, spying on training is pointless
text:
Eddie Jones says nothing by accident. There is no such thing as a slip of the tongue and every word he says, whether for internal or external consumption, has a purpose.

Most of the time when he says something controversial it will be to help take the heat off the players. He is shifting the focus of attention so suddenly everyone is talking about Eddie rather than about the squad. That is just the way he is.

He knows exactly how the PR game works. He knows what turns the wheels of the media - I am sure every journalist in Tokyo will be loving the fact that he did this press conference. He has provided a talking point and a bit of entertainment.

He likes to have fun and to put himself out there....
description: Eddie Jones says nothing by accident.
